questions.question: Which component acts as the brain of the computer, processing all the instructions?
questions.hint: Think of the part responsible for carrying out commands and calculations.

questions.question: Which storage type is generally faster and more durable?
questions.hint: This type has no moving parts.

questions.question: The ___ temporarily stores data for quick access while the computer is running.
questions.hint: This memory is volatile and resets when the computer is turned off.

questions.question: RAM is used for long-term data storage.
questions.hint: Think about the purpose of RAM in relation to data storage.

questions.question: To check CPU compatibility with a motherboard, you must ensure the CPU socket type is the same as the motherboard ___.
questions.hint: This part of the CPU must match the motherboard socket.

questions.question: Match components with images.
questions.hint: Match each label with the correct image based on component function.

questions.question: Which component plugs into the motherboard shown in the center image?
questions.hint: This component is typically long and thin, with multiple slots that plug directly into the motherboard.

questions.question: Your PC does not power on. The first component you should check is the ___ supply.
questions.hint: This component provides power to the entire system.

questions.question: If your system randomly restarts during use, you should check for ___ issues.
questions.hint: This component may be overheating or failing.

questions.question: USB devices aren't recognized when plugged in. What steps can you take to resolve this issue?
questions.hint: Think about common troubleshooting steps for USB connection issues.
